publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2756 Margaret Mitchell: Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival—That the Parliament congratulates the excellent and important work of the Mental Health Foundation and partners for the Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival; welcomes the production of the play, Talk To Me, performed by a group of young people from Hamilton Information Project for Youth and Healthy Valley Clydesdale, at the Motherwell Theatre, and commends the fact that the play effectively and informatively highlights the mental health challenges facing young people today, including issues of bullying, self-harm, eating disorders, bereavement and drug and alcohol issues. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Mary Scanlon*, Bill Aitken*, Ted Brocklebank*, Jamie McGrigor*, Jackson Carlaw*, Patrick Harvie*, Murdo Fraser*, Bill Kidd*, John Lamont*, Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*, Robin Harper*, Kenneth Gibson*, Nanette Milne*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Bob Doris*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Keith Brown*, Jack McConnell*, Sandra White*

S3M-2756 Margaret Mitchell: Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival—That the Parliament congratulates the excellent and important work of the Mental Health Foundation and partners for the Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival; welcomes the production of the play, Talk To Me, performed by a group of young people from Hamilton Information Project for Youth and Healthy Valley Clydesdale, at the Motherwell Theatre, and commends the fact that the play effectively and informatively highlights the mental health challenges facing young people today, including issues of bullying, self-harm, eating disorders, bereavement and drug and alcohol issues. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Bill Aitken, Ted Brocklebank, Jamie McGrigor, Jackson Carlaw, Patrick Harvie, Murdo Fraser, Bill Kidd, John Lamont, Jamie Hepburn, Gil Paterson, Robin Harper, Kenneth Gibson, Nanette Milne, Roseanna Cunningham, Christina McKelvie, Bob Doris, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Keith Brown, Jack McConnell, Sandra White, Michael Matheson*
S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Trish Godman*
S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Stuart McMillan*
S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Ken Macintosh*
S3M-2756 Scottish Mental Health Art and Film Festival (lodged on 27 October 2008) Tom McCabe*
